answers.author: Donnie Crain
answers.text:
In a community I formerly worked with on the Gulf Coast, we worked through the local university's business/economic research center to monitor our tourism-related economic health.  That provided a "buffer" between the the local businesses we collected visitation and other data from and provided a measure of validity with the data coming from an independent third party versus if we ourselves collected and reported the data.   We did pay the center each year to conduct the program and not only did it provide us with information we needed, it strengthened our relationship with the university and its studens who were interested in tourism development activities.

text: For resort communiites and others who have a need for micro economic data, How do you follow the economic indicators for your community?  Do you have an internal program or contract with someone?  If you contract, who with?
